00040 #ifndef _resourcemanager_h
00041 #define _resourcemanager_h
00042 
00043 #include "managerbase.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 
00046 class btBulletWorldImporter;
00047 
00048 namespace Ogre
00049 {
00050     class ResourceGroupManager;
00051 }
00052 
00053 namespace phys
00054 {
00055     class ActorBase;
00056     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00057     /// @class ResourceManager
00058     /// @headerfile resourcemanager.h
00059     /// @brief This is the manager responsible for the loading and unloading of files.
00060     /// @details This class is responsible for the reading and writing of files of all kinds, be
00061     /// it graphical meshes, physics data, or XMl files.
00062     ///////////////////////////////////////
00063     class ResourceManager : public ManagerBase {
00064         protected:
00065             /// @brief Encapsulates the functionality of the ogre resource group manager.
00066             Ogre::ResourceGroupManager* OgreResource;
00067             /// @brief Applies a saved shape to an Actor.
00068             void ApplyShapeToActor(ActorBase* Actor, btCollisionShape* ColShape);
00069         public:
00070             /// @brief Class constructor.
00071             /// @details Standard manager constructor with World pointer.
00072             ResourceManager(World* _World);
00073             /// @details Class Destructor.
00074             ~ResourceManager();
00075             /// @brief Exports an actors shape data to a file.
00076             /// @details Remember to include a ".bullet" extension to the filename when serializing.
00077             bool ExportShapeData(ActorBase* Actor, String &FileName);
00078             /// @brief Imports serialized shape data from the disk to be used in an Actor.
00079             /// @details Remember to include a ".bullet" extension to the filename when loading.
00080             bool ImportShapeData(ActorBase* Actor, String &FileName);
00081 
00082             /// @brief Adds a location for graphical resources.
00083             /// @details This function will add a location on the disk to find files needed to create and
00084             /// manipulate graphical objects.
00085             /// @param Location The location on the file system the resource can be found.
00086             /// @param Type The kind of file system the location can be found in. @n
00087             /// Options are: filesystem, zip.
00088             /// @param Group The name of the group the resources at this location belong to.
00089             /// @param recursive Whether or not to search sub-directories.
00090             void AddResourceLocation(const String &Location, const String &Type, const String &Group, const bool &recursive=false);
00091             /// @brief Prepares the resource for use.
00092             /// @details This function can be thought of as a preloader.  This will prepare the defined
00093             /// resource located on the disk for use.
00094             /// @param Name Name of the file/resource to be 'prepared'.
00095             /// @param Type The type of resource that the file is. @n
00096             /// Options are: Font, GpuProgram, HighLevelGpuProgram, Material, Mesh, Skeleton, Texture.
00097             /// @param Group Name of the group the resource belongs to.
00098             void DeclareResource(String Name, String Type, String Group);
00099             /// @brief Makes a resource group ready to use.
00100             /// @details After adding all of your resources and declaring them as nessessary, this function
00101             /// is the final step.  After calling this function any and all resources within the defined group
00102             /// will be ready to use.  Do not initialize any more groups then you need to however, as that will
00103             /// take up memory and drop performance.
00104             /// @param Name Name of the resource group.
00105             void InitResourceGroup(String Name);
00106 
00107             ////Functions inherited from ManagerBase
00108             /// @brief Empty Initializor
00109             /// @details This specific initializor is unneeded, but we implement it for compatibility. It also exists
00110             /// in case a derived class wants to override it for some reason.
00111             void Initialize();
00112             /// @brief Empty MainLoopItems
00113             /// @details This class implements this for the sake of entension and compatibility this function does nothing. This is just empty during this round of refactoring,
00114             /// and this will get all the functionality that currently should be here, but is in the world.
00115             void DoMainLoopItems();
00116             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00117             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::ResourceManager
00118             ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00119     };
00120 }
00121 
00122 #endif
